Pre-Game Insights: There is a forecast of a heavy downpour at MCG tomorrow that may significantly impact the contest.

India will be coming to this contest on the back of some steaming form in the shortest format of the game as they tamed the likes of a high-flying Australia and full-fledged South Africa back home while also getting the better of the hosts in a warm-up contest.

India will be relying heavily upon their batting that features KL Rahul, Rohit Sharma, and Virat Kohli, while a rock-solid middle-order comprising Suryakumar Yadav, Hardik Pandya, and Dinesh Karthik will provide them the much-needed bookend.
India will have a major leak to plug when it comes to their death bowling with Jasprit Bumrah out of the equation.

Pakistan has been in the midst of a tempestuous journey of late where they drubbed New Zealand and Bangladesh in a tri-series but were also tamed by England back home and in a warm-up contest ahead of the biennial extravaganza.
Pakistan has a strong opening pair in Babar Azam and Mohammad Rizwan but their major concern will be a wobbling middle-order.
Pakistan has a fine bowling line-up featuring some of the world’s finest quicks that provide the major threat that Pakistan challenges the world with.
The return of Virat Kohli to form since the Asia Cup will act as a major uplift for India as he holds an impressive record against Pakistan in the shortest format of the game.
Shaheen Afridi is like a merchant of menace on the pacy surfaces of Australia and would be desperate to produce that edge or the nick.

Hardik Pandya is a dynamic all-rounder who can chime in with crucial runs in the middle-order and that too at a tempestuous pace while he is capable of making good use of those short balls as a bowler.
Shadab Khan is an excellent spinner and can be a crucial player for Pakistan in the lower end of the batting order.
Mohammed Shami versus Babar Azam is highlighted as a key contest given their past encounters and the different conditions in Australia.
Head-to-head record: Matches played: 11, India won: 7, Pakistan won: 3.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Weather conditions may affect the match as there is a forecast of a heavy downpour at MCG.
Historical head-to-head statistics: India has won 7 out of 11 matches against Pakistan.
